results.abstract: What is it about the director that draws stars like Frances McDormand and Tilda Swinton again and again? There are many reasons, but the nightly feasts don’t hurt.

results.title: Loose and Boxed Ammunition Found at Scene of Alec Baldwin Shooting
results.abstract: Court papers did not specify what kind of ammunition detectives recovered from a movie set where the actor had fatally shot a cinematographer with a gun he was told did not contain live rounds.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

multimedia.caption: Alec Baldwin was told the gun he was rehearsing with contained no live rounds when it discharged on a movie set, killing the cinematographer. He spoke on the phone outside the Santa Fe County Sherriff’s Office on Thursday after speaking with investigators.

results.title: Mort Sahl, Whose Biting Commentary Redefined Stand-Up, Dies at 94
results.abstract: A self-appointed warrior against hypocrisy, he revolutionized comedy in the 1950s by addressing political and social issues.

multimedia.caption: The comedian Mort Sahl early in his career. An inveterate contrarian and a wide-ranging skeptic, he was known to ask audiences, “Are there any groups I haven’t offended?”

results.title: Dorothy Steel, Whose Big-Screen Career Had a Late Start, Dies at 95
results.abstract: She was cast in “Black Panther” at 90, not long after she began acting professionally. “As soon as we saw her,” the movie’s casting director said, “we wanted her.”

results.title: Alec Baldwin Was Told Gun in Fatal Shooting on Set Was Safe, Officials Say
results.abstract: The actor was told a gun being used as a prop was safe before he fired it on the set of “Rust,” killing the film’s cinematographer and wounding its director, law enforcement officials said.
results.byline: By Simon Romero, Julia Jacobs and Glenn Thrush

results.title: Diane Weyermann, Executive Who Championed ‘An Inconvenient Truth,’ Dies at 66
results.abstract: A former public interest lawyer, she oversaw this and many other documentaries that addressed urgent social issues.

multimedia.caption: The movie executive Diane Weyermann, known for her socially conscious documentaries, at the Sundance Film Festival in 2007. “It is not an exaggeration,” former Vice President Al Gore said, “to say she really did change the world.”

results.title: Jack Whitehall Will Do Anything to Get to the Glastonbury Festival
results.abstract: When he’s not getting fitted on Savile Row or jogging to the “E.T.” score, the actor and comedian can be found in the “Clifford the Big Red Dog” movie.
